head.title: After Blowing Lead, Yankees Rally in Ninth on Hill's Grand Slam

hedline.hl1: After Blowing Lead, Yankees Rally in Ninth on Hill's Grand Slam

abstract.p: New York Yankees defeat Minnesota Twins, 9-5; photo (M)

block.p: One week after the Yankees acquired Glenallen Hill from the Chicago Cubs to provide some right-handed punch to the lineup, he supplied a roundhouse tonight. In a 5-5 game with the bases loaded in the ninth at the Metrodome, Hill drove a pitch over the center-field fence, and those four runs were the difference in the Yankees' 9-5 victory over the Minnesota Twins.

Mariano Rivera has had many saves for the Yankees, but his teammates are making a habit of saving him. For the second time this month, the Yankees came roaring back after Rivera allowed an opponent to take a lead in the late innings -- and it was the newest Yankee, Hill, who applied the coup de grace.

Mariano Rivera has had many saves for the Yankees, but his teammates are making a habit of saving him. For the second time this month, the Yankees came roaring back after Rivera allowed an opponent to take a lead in the late innings -- and it was the newest Yankee, Hill, who applied the coup de grace.

Hill's pinch-hit grand slam off Minnesota's Bob Wells came one batter after Jorge Posada had tied the game with his fourth hit of the night. Rivera, who had blown a two-run lead in the eighth, was credited with the victory.

On July 17, the Yankees trailed Philadelphia by 6-1 in the ninth inning, scored five runs to tie, and after Rivera allowed two runs in the 10th, the Yankees scored three in the bottom of the 10th to win.

Paul O'Neill led off the ninth tonight with a single off the left-hander Travis Miller. David Justice followed by ripping a line drive into the gap in right-center that bounced over the fence for a ground-rule double. Eddie Guardado fell behind Tino Martinez, three balls and no strikes, before he was walked intentionally, loading the bases. BASEBALL
